awd_titl_txt: Conference: Student Travel Grant Request for IEEE International Symposium on Performance Analysis of Systems and Software
awd_abstract_narration:
This travel award helps fund undergraduate and graduate students from US-based institutions to attend and participate in the 2023 IEEE International Symposium on Performance Analysis of Systems and Software (ISPASS). The conference will be held in April 2023 in Raleigh, North Carolina. ISPASS is a top conference in the field of computer systems and software. The conference is sponsored by the IEEE Computer Society Technical Committee on Computer Architecture, Technical Committee on Microprogramming and Microarchitecture, and Technical Committee on Internet. ISPASS provides a forum for sharing advances in academic and industrial research focused on performance analysis and the design of computer systems. Students will be able to attend all events associated with the conference, as well as a rich set of workshops and a diverse tutorial program. Students with disabilities or those attending with a child under one year of age may request additional funds to support a travel companion.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Computer and Information Science and Engineering
org_div_long_name: Division of Computing and Communication Foundations

inst.inst_name: University of Kansas Center for Research Inc

por.por_cntn:
The purpose of this project was to request travel support funds to assist undergraduate and graduate students from US-based institutions in attending and participating in the 2023 IEEE International Symposium on Performance Analysis of Systems and Software (ISPASS). The intellectual merit of this project includes providing professional development opportunities for undergraduate and graduate students and contributing to the continued growth of the symposium. The conference took place in April 2023 in Raleigh, North Carolina. ISPASS is a premier conference in the field of computer systems' performance analysis, sponsored by the IEEE Computer Society Technical Committee on Computer Architecture, Technical Committee on Microprogramming and Microarchitecture, and Technical Committee on the Internet.

This project provided students with the opportunity to receive travel support, enabling them to attend ISPASS 2023 and stay updated on the latest developments in performance analysis, system software, and architecture. The funding from this project facilitated the attendance of 18 undergraduate and graduate students from US-based institutions at the conference in Raleigh, North Carolina. Among these 18 students, 4 are identified as underrepresented in computing. Attending the conference allowed these students to present their research, attend technical sessions and tutorials, and network with other researchers in the field.

The technical contributions from this symposium encompassed various topics, including CPU microarchitecture, software simulators for hardware, machine learning, emerging workloads, and hardware accelerators. The event featured two keynote addresses delivered by leading researchers from Microsoft and Duke University. Additionally, there were two workshops on the performance analysis of machine learning systems and quantum computer systems. Finally, there were two tutorials covering the design space exploration of deep learning systems and the integration of pre-designed intellectual properties into simulators. Such a robust technical program served as an excellent educational opportunity for all attendees. 

 


Last Modified: 01/02/2024
Modified by: Mohammad Alian
